2.text: Wash your hands for 20 seconds with soap and water.

3.text: Practice physical distancing by staying home as much as possible.

4.text: Stay at least 6 ft (1.8 m) away from other people when in public.

5.text: Keep your hands away from your eyes, nose, and mouth.

6.text: Avoid shaking hands with other people, whether they appear sick or not.

7.text: Distance yourself from people who are coughing and sneezing.

8.text: Disinfect surfaces before you touch them, both in public and at home.

9.text: Wear a cloth face-covering in public.

10.text: Fill your pantry and freezer with 2-4 weeks worth of food.

11.text: Purchase extras of essentials like toilet paper, soap, and detergent.

12.text: Get over-the-counter treatments used for a respiratory infection.

13.text: Make sure you have at least a 30-day supply of medications you take.

14.text: Plan for childcare in the event that schools and daycares must close.

15.text: Talk to your boss about possible work-from-home options.

16.text: Research the aid organizations in your area if you may lose income.

17.text: Check for coronavirus updates just once or twice a day.

18.text: Create a family plan for a coronavirus outbreak so you feel calm.

19.text: Make healthy lifestyle choices to help boost your immune system.

20.text: Call your doctor if you’re worried you have symptoms.

21.text: Check travel warnings before you take a trip and avoid nonessential travel.
